content:
As an Oathbreaker Paladin who has turned away from the teachings of his order, Azrael Blackwood has rejected the deity he once worshiped and abandoned his oath. It is not uncommon for Paladins to fall from grace and become Oathbreakers, often as a result of a personal crisis or a traumatic event that causes them to question their faith.

In Azrael's case, his betrayal of Bahamut may have been due to a number of factors, such as a perceived injustice or a personal ambition that conflicted with the tenets of his order. Perhaps he witnessed an event that made him question the benevolence of his deity, or he may have become disillusioned with the corruption and hypocrisy within his order.

Another possibility is that Azrael was seduced by the promises of power and influence offered by a darker force, such as a powerful demon or a cult that worshiped an evil deity. This temptation may have been too great for him to resist, leading him down a path of corruption and evil.

Regardless of the specific circumstances, Azrael's decision to betray Bahamut would have had significant consequences for his personal journey and the world around him. He would have lost his divine powers and the favor of his deity, and he would have become an outcast among his former allies and comrades.
